document.masterDocTitle: On some Encyrtidae (Hymenoptera: Chalcidoidea) from Namdapha Tiger Reserve in Arunachal Pradesh, India

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: On some Encyrtidae (Hymenoptera: Chalcidoidea) from Namdapha Tiger Reserve in Arunachal Pradesh, India

heading.emphasis:
Key to world species of
Rhytidothorax
(females)

subSubSection.paragraph: [Note: maxillary palp 4 -segmented and labial palp 3 -segmented unless noted otherwise; other features that are specific to the species and distributions are given between brackets.]

paragraph.keyLead: 1 . Antennal funicle with at least distal three segments (F 4â€“6 ) quadrate to broader than long............................. 2
- Antennal funicle with all segments longer than broad, rarely F 6 quadrate........................................ 13

2 ( 1 ). Antenna with scape flattened and expanded beneath, not more than
2 x
as long as broad [maxillary palp 3 -segmented, labial palp 2 -segmented]..................................................................................... 3

- Scape at most slightly flattened and at least
3 x
as long as broad................................................. 4

3 ( 2 ). Pedicel and flagellum dark brown; legs brownish yellow [ Australia ].........................
R. aeriscutellum (Girault)

- Pedicel and funicle pale brownish yellow, clava suffused with blackish brown; legs largely dark blackish brown to black [ Swaziland ; Zimbabwe ].........................................................
R. latiscapus (Prinsloo & Annecke)

4 ( 2 ). Scape at least slightly flattened with ventral margin usually at least slightly convex,
3â€“ 4
x as long as broad.............. 5
5 ( 4 ). Antennal torulus less than own height to mouth margin and its upper margin below lower margin of eye................ 6

- Antennal torulus placed higher, at least its own height from mouth margin and its upper margin above lower margin of eye [scape with basal one-third to half dark brown; F 6 and clava yellow to white]..................................... 7

6 ( 5 ). Frontovertex nearly half ( 0.48 x) head width; eye height 2.5 x malar space; POL 2.6 x OOL and 5.2 x OCL; scape about
3 x
as long as broad; fore wing with marginal vein longer than stigmal and postmarginal veins ( 1.5 : 1.3 : 1.0); body dark brown, with head and scutellum metallic green; legs and antennae honey yellow [palp segments unknown; Grenada ]...
R. hirtus (Howard)

- Frontovertex about one-third ( 0.31 x) head width; eye height 1.71 x malar space; POL
4 x
OOL and 3.42 x OCL; scape 3.4 x to nearly
4 x
as long as broad; fore wing with marginal vein slightly longer than stigmal vein, but distinctly shorter than postmarginal vein ( 0.83 : 0.66 : 1.0); body nearly black with sides of pronotum, prepectus, mesopleuron, mesoscutum largely, and base and sides of scutellum brownish yellow; scape brownish yellow except apically brown; pedicel and F 3 dark brown; F 4 yellowish brown, F 5 pale brownish yellow, F 6 and clava yellow to white; legs brownish yellow except mid coxae dark brown [maxillary palp 3 -segmented, labial palp 2 -segmented; India ].......................................
R. horticola
sp. nov.

- Body dark metallic purple except mesoscutum, propodeum, and sides and venter of mesosoma deep reddish orange [maxillary palp 3 -segmented, labial palp 2 -segmented; Australia ].....................................
R. auratiscutum (Girault)

8 ( 4 ). F 1 subequal in length to pedicel [F 6 and clava brownish yellow; legs brownish yellow except coxae dark brown; fore wing with marginal vein distinctly longer than postmarginal or stigmal veins ( 11 : 7 : 7 ); scape
7 x
as long as broad; body completely dark with blue and purple luster; maxillary palp 3 -segmented, labial palp 2 -segmented; Argentina ]..
R. flaviclava (De Santis)

9 ( 8 ). Scape at least about
6 x
as long as broad [body dark brown to black]............................................. 10

- Scape clearly less than
5 x
as long as broad [legs yellow with mid coxae dark; maxillary palp 3 -segmented, labial palp 2 -segmented)............................................................................................ 12

10 ( 9 ). Pedicel about
3 x
as long as broad; F 1 slightly less than
2 x
as long as broad ( 7 : 4 ); fore wing with marginal vein as long as stigmal vein [F 2â€“6 quadrate to distinctly broader than long, F 2 = 5 : 5 and F 6 = 4.5 : 6.5 ; USA ]...........
R. marlatti Ashmead

- Pedicel less than
3 x
as long as broad; F 1 quadrate to slightly longer than broad; fore wing with marginal vein distinctly shorter than stigmal vein [last segment of fore tarsus with setae in a comb-like arrangement).............................. 11

11 ( 10 ). Antennal toruli with upper margins in line with lower margins of eyes; antennal clava with second suture perpendicular and third segment with only apex transversely truncate; fore wing with marginal vein about as long as postmarginal vein; ovipositor 0.92 x mid tibia length [ India ]................................................
R. pectinatum Singh & Agarwal

- Antennal toruli with upper margins far below lower margins of eyes; clava with second suture oblique and third segment obliquely truncate; fore wing with marginal vein 1.52 x as long as postmarginal vein; ovipositor 0.8 x mid tibia length [ India ]....................................................................................
R. namdapha
sp. nov.

12 ( 9 ). Head black except sides of pronotum, mesoscutum, tegula, subbasal region of gaster brownish yellow; scutellum darkened with bluish reflections; antennae brownish yellow; F 2â€“4 quadrate and F 5 and F 6 broader than long; clava apparently 2 -segmented; frontovertex width 0.41 x head width [ Argentina ].................................
R . flavicornis (De Santis)

- Body completely dark; antennae dark except scape yellowish; F 2 â€“F 4 each very slightly longer than broad, F 5 and F 6 quadrate; clava 3 -segmented; frontovertex 0.46 x head width [ Argentina ].............................
R. perhispidus (De Santis)

13 ( 1 ). F 1 clearly less than
3 x
as long as broad and scape longer than combined length of F 1â€“3 ; fore wing with postmarginal vein longer than marginal and stigmal veins individually; funicle dark and clava white [maxillary palp 3 -segmented, labial palp 2 -segmented]............................................................................................ 14

- F 1 at least
3 x
as long as broad and scape at most as long as combined length of F 1â€“3 ; fore wing with postmarginal vein shorter than either marginal or stigmal veins; funicle with at least F 6 and clava white to yellow............................. 15

14 ( 13 ). Head, pronotum, anterior part of mesoscutum, scutellum, and gaster metallic purple; rest of body orange-yellow [ Australia ]..............................................................................
R. purpureiscutellum (Girault)

- Body completely dark green [ Australia ]......................................................
R. ferus (Girault)

15 ( 13 ). Fore wing at least slightly more than
3 x
as long as broad; marginal vein longer than stigmal vein; propodeum 0.4 x scutellum length; last segment of fore tarsus with setae in a comb-like arrangement; third valvula distinctly articulated with second valvifer; flagellar segments longer, F 1 at least
5 x
as long as broad; distal half of F 5 , F 6 and clava yellow; fore wing distinctly infuscated beyond venation [ India ]........................................................
R. ramakrishnai
sp. nov.

- Fore wing 2.5â€“2.65 x as long as broad; marginal vein shorter than stigmal vein; propodeum at most 0.3 x scutellum length; last segment of fore tarsus without a comb; third valvula fused with apex of second valvifer; flagellar segments relatively shorter, F 1 at most
4 x
as long as broad; distal part of F 4 as well as F 5 , F 6 and clava yellow (some specimens with F 5 brownish yellow); fore wing infuscation on disc diffuse [ India ]..........................................
R. nigrum Singh & Agarwal
